title: Game Foundation Epic
description: Set up the core Next.js application with Turbo, Redis session management, and foundational game state architecture.
close_reason: All foundation tasks complete: Next.js app, Redis session, game state schema

title: Core Game Systems Epic
description: Implement the layered pulse system (Global  City  Neighborhood  Family) with drift mechanics, event triggers, and cross-layer propagation.
close_reason: All core systems complete: Global/City/Neighborhood/Family pulse, events, cross-layer propagation

title: Implement Global pulse system
description: Implement GlobalPulse with enforcementClimate, mediaNarrative, judicialAlignment, politicalVolatility. Update every 14-28 turns. Create GlobalEvent triggers.
close_reason: Implemented updateGlobalPulse with volatility-based drift, shouldUpdateGlobalPulse for 14-28 turn cadence

title: Implement City pulse system
description: Implement CityPulse with federalCooperation, dataDensity, politicalCover, civilSocietyCapacity, bureaucraticInertia. Update every 7 turns. Handle CityEvents.
close_reason: Implemented updateCityPulse with global pressure propagation, weekly update cadence

title: Implement Neighborhood pulse system
description: Implement NeighborhoodPulse with trust, suspicion, enforcementVisibility, communityDensity, economicPrecarity. Update every turn. Handle NeighborhoodEvents.
close_reason: Implemented updateNeighborhoodPulse with cross-layer propagation from city/global, family influence

title: Implement Family impact system
description: Implement FamilyImpact with visibility, stress, cohesion, trustNetworkStrength. These are modified by player choices and affect neighborhood pulses.
close_reason: Implemented updateFamilyImpact with stress/cohesion dynamics based on neighborhood conditions

title: Implement event system
description: Create event selection engine: weighted random based on pulse values, event pools per layer, severity scaling, duration tracking, and consequence resolution.
close_reason: Implemented weighted random selection, trigger probability based on pulse, event templates for all layers, effect application, expiry pruning

title: Implement cross-layer propagation
description: Implement propagation rules: effects flow down easily (globalcityneighborhood), up slowly. Use formulas from spec as starting point, tune for balance.
close_reason: Already implemented in pulse.ts: global->city->neighborhood propagation with formulas from spec, family influence on neighborhoods

title: Turn System Epic
description: Implement the core gameplay loop: narrative prompts, player choices, unlock system, and consequence resolution within ~80 turn game arc.
close_reason: Turn system complete: state machine, decision phase, choice/unlock, family variable effects

title: Design turn state machine
description: Define turn phases: Plan  Pulse Update  Event  Decision  Consequence. Implement state machine with clear transitions and hooks for UI.
close_reason: Implemented 5-phase turn loop (plan/pulse_update/event/decision/consequence), phase transitions, complete turn runner

title: Implement narrative prompt UI
description: Build the core turn interface: display current situation, show narrative prompt text, render single-select and multi-select choice options.
close_reason: Created NarrativePrompt component with single/multi-select, unlock conditions, choice effects display. Created StatusDisplay with family/neighborhood stat bars.

title: Initialize Next.js app with Turbo
description: Create the Next.js application using create-next-app with Turbo. Set up basic project structure, TypeScript config, and development environment.
close_reason: Created Next.js app with TypeScript, Tailwind, ESLint, App Router, and Turbopack

title: Implement choice/unlock system
description: Create system for conditional choice availability. Choices unlock based on: family variables, turn count, previous choices, neighborhood state, rights knowledge.
close_reason: Implemented unlockConditions on choices (requiredChoices, minTurn, stats thresholds), filtering in decision generation

title: Connect choices to family variables
description: Implement consequence engine: map player choices to family variable changes (visibility, stress, cohesion, trust network). Handle tradeoffs (work vs community).
close_reason: Implemented effects application on family variables via applyEventEffects, choice recording in history

title: Content Generation Epic
description: Generate all city profiles, neighborhood data, and event content for the 20 launch cities using the profiling pipeline.

title: Generate profiles for all 20 cities
description: Run city profiling agent for: LA, SF, Phoenix, Seattle, El Paso, Tucson, San Antonio, Chicago, Detroit, Minneapolis, Columbus, Houston, Miami, Atlanta, Nashville, NYC, Boston, Philadelphia, Newark, Denver.
close_reason: Generated city profiles for all 20 launch cities

title: Create base event pools
description: Write/generate event templates for each event type: Audit, Checkpoint, RaidRumor, Meeting, Detention (neighborhood); Policy, Budget, Infrastructure, Media (city); Executive, Judicial, Media, Security (global).
close_reason: Created 54 event templates across all layers: 18 neighborhood, 18 city, 18 global events

title: Create city-specific special events
description: For each city, create 3-5 special events based on recent news that can dramatically shift neighborhood conditions. These become content refresh pipeline.
close_reason: Created city-specific special events for 6 launch cities: LA, Chicago, Miami, Phoenix, NYC, Houston (30 events total)

title: Victory Conditions Epic
description: Implement the three win conditions (Sanctuary, Outlast, Transform) and failure states with clear mechanical triggers.
close_reason: Victory conditions epic complete: thresholds defined and detection implemented

title: Define victory/failure thresholds
description: Specify exact conditions for each ending: Sanctuary (local protection threshold), Outlast (survive N turns until political shift), Transform (exposure/pressure threshold). Define failure states.
close_reason: Defined in turn.ts: Sanctuary (trust>=80, community>=70, network>=80), Outlast (survive maxTurns with climate<40), Transform (cover>=80, cooperation<=20, narrative<=-50), Failure (stress>=95, cohesion<=10)

title: Implement ending detection and resolution
description: Create system to check win/loss conditions each turn, trigger appropriate ending sequences, and handle game completion state.
close_reason: Implemented checkGameEnding() in turn.ts that checks all conditions each turn and sets GameEnding state

title: Create /dashboard cities list page
description:
## Deliverable
Create the main dashboard page showing all 20 cities in a grid layout with pulse summary.

## Files to Modify
- src/app/dashboard/page.tsx (replace placeholder)

## Complexity: Medium

## Implementation Details
- Server component using getCities() from src/lib/content.ts
- Grid layout with city cards (responsive: 1-3 columns)
- Each card shows: city name, state, pulse values using PulseBar
- Cards link to /dashboard/cities/[id]
- Dark theme: bg-black, zinc-900 cards, amber accents

## Dependencies
- Requires PulseBar component (icecream-6nu)
- Uses getCities() from content service

## Acceptance Criteria
- Page loads and displays all cities from Supabase
- Cities shown in alphabetical order
- Each city card shows name, state, and 5 pulse metrics
- Clicking a card navigates to city detail page
- No TypeScript errors
close_reason: Implemented cities list dashboard page with PulseBar component and content service

title: Set up Redis connection and session management
description: Integrate Redis client (ioredis or similar), implement session ID generation, and create basic get/set helpers for game state persistence.
close_reason: Added ioredis client, session ID generation with uuid, get/set/delete game state helpers, 7-day TTL

title: ICE Cream Project: Integration & Polish
description:
# Integration & Polish **Priority:** P3 **Dependencies:** All other beads ## Overview Integrate all systems together, add polish, and deploy the game. ## Integration Tasks ### 1. Main Game Loop Integration ```tsx // src/App.tsx function App() { const gameState = useGameState(); const queue = useQueue(gameState); const [currentEntity, setCurrentEntity] = useState(null); return (
{currentEntity && }
); } ``` ### 2. State Persistence - Save to localStorage on each day end - Load from localStorage on refresh - Export/import save as JSON (for debugging) ### 3. End-to-End Flow 1. Start game Main screen with all zones 2. Select featured flavor Day begins 3. Queue generates Customers arrive 4. Interactions State changes 5. Agent encounter Overlay appears 6. Choices made Resolution 7. End of day Summary screen 8. Sleep Next day ### 4. Mobile Polish - Touch feedback (visual ripple) - Prevent scroll/zoom - Back button handling - Loading states ### 5. Performance - Memoize expensive components - Lazy load overlays - Optimize re-renders ### 6. Accessibility - Keyboard navigation - Screen reader labels - High contrast mode - Reduced motion option ### 7. Deployment - Build for production - Test on mobile devices - Deploy to GitHub Pages / Netlify / Vercel ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Full game playable from start to finish - [ ] Save/load working - [ ] No console errors - [ ] Mobile-optimized (tested on real device) - [ ] Performance: 60fps on target devices - [ ] Deployed and accessible via URL ## Dependencies **BLOCKS ON:** All other beads complete

title: Define game state schema
description: Define TypeScript interfaces for complete game state: GlobalPulse, CityPulse, NeighborhoodPulse, FamilyImpact, Events, and turn state. Store in Redis.
close_reason: Implemented complete game state schema with types, validation, and factory functions

title: City Profiling Pipeline Epic
description: Build tooling and agent workflows to generate structured city data from real news sources and demographic data for all 20 launch cities.

title: ICE Cream Project: UI Components (6 Zones + Overlays)

title: Create PulseBar reusable component for pulse visualization
description:
## Deliverable
Create a reusable PulseBar component for visualizing pulse values (0-100 scale) consistently across the dashboard. Based on the StatBar pattern from StatusDisplay.tsx.

## Files to Create
- src/components/dashboard/PulseBar.tsx

## Complexity: Small

## Implementation Details
- Server component (no 'use client' needed)
- Props: label, value (0-100), color (amber/red/green/blue)
- Visual: horizontal bar with fill based on value percentage
- Follow existing dark theme: zinc-700 background, colored fill

## Acceptance Criteria
- Component renders pulse values as horizontal bars
- Supports multiple color variants
- Follows existing StatusDisplay styling patterns
- No TypeScript errors
close_reason: Created PulseBar component with label, value (0-100), and color variants

title: Set up Census ACS API integration
description: Create utility to fetch demographic data from Census American Community Survey API. Target: population, median income, foreign-born %, language data, housing costs.
close_reason: Already implemented: getCityDemographics, getAllLaunchCityDemographics, FIPS mappings for all 20 cities, formatDemographicsForAgent

title: Define city data schema
description: Define TypeScript interfaces matching the spec: CityPulse, NeighborhoodPulse, CityEvent, NeighborhoodEvent. Include validation and defaults.
close_reason: Defined CityProfile, Neighborhood, CityPulse, NeighborhoodPulse, event templates. Includes 20 launch cities list.

title: ICE Cream Project: TypeScript Type System Foundation
Create city profiling agent workflow
description: Design agent prompt and workflow that takes NewsAPI + Census data and produces structured city profiles per CITY_PROFILING_BRIEF. Output: JSON city files.
close_reason: Created city-profiler.ts: gatherCityProfilingContext, generateCityProfilingPrompt, parseAgentResponse, convertToGameProfile, default event generators

title: Create /dashboard/cities/[id] city detail page
description:
## Deliverable
Create the city detail page showing city overview and all neighborhoods with their pulse values.

## Files to Modify
- src/app/dashboard/cities/[id]/page.tsx (replace placeholder)

## Complexity: Medium

## Implementation Details
- Server component using getCityWithNeighborhoods(id) from src/lib/content.ts
- Display city name, state, overview text
- Show city pulse values using PulseBar
- List all neighborhoods with:
  - Name and description
  - Neighborhood pulse values (trust, suspicion, etc.)
- Back link to /dashboard
- Handle 404 case if city not found

## Dependencies
- Requires PulseBar component (icecream-6nu)
- Uses getCityWithNeighborhoods() from content service

## Acceptance Criteria
- Page loads city data from Supabase by ID
- Shows city overview and pulse metrics
- Lists all neighborhoods with their pulse values
- Returns 404 for invalid city IDs
- No TypeScript errors
close_reason: Created city detail page with neighborhood list and pulse metrics

title: ICE Cream Project: Base Setup & Tooling
description:
# Base Setup & Tooling

**Priority:** P0 (Can work in parallel with TYPES)

## Overview
Set up the React + TypeScript project with all necessary tooling for a one-day game jam.

## Tech Stack
- **Framework:** React 18 with Vite (fast dev server, optimized builds)
- **Language:** TypeScript 5.x
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS v4 (utility-first, matches pixel art needs)
- **Testing:** Vitest + React Testing Library
- **State:** Zustand (lightweight, no boilerplate)
- **Fonts:** Google Fonts (Press Start 2P or VT323 for pixel art)

## Setup Tasks

### 1. Project Initialization
```bash
npm create vite@latest icecream -- --template react-ts
cd icecream
npm install
```

### 2. Install Dependencies
```bash
# Runtime
npm install zustand

# Testing
npm install -D vitest @testing-library/react @testing-library/jest-dom @testing-library/user-event

# Pixel font
# (We'll use Google Fonts CDN for simplicity)
```

### 3. Configure Vite
- Set up port 5173
- Enable HMR
- Configure build for static hosting

### 4. Configure Tailwind CSS v4
```css
/* src/styles.css - SINGLE SOURCE FOR COLOR IMPORT */
@import 'tailwindcss';
@theme {
  /* Colors will be imported from types/colors.ts */
}
```

### 5. Configure Vitest
```js
// vitest.config.ts
import { defineConfig } from 'vitest/config';
import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react';

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react()],
  test: {
    globals: true,
    environment: 'jsdom',
  },
});
```

### 6. Project Structure
```
src/
 App.tsx                 # Root component
 main.tsx                # Entry point
 styles.css              # Global styles + Tailwind
 types/                  # TypeScript types
 components/             # React components
    shop/              # Zone 1-5 components
    dialogue/          # Dialogue overlay
    encounter/         # Agent encounter UI
    summary/           # End-of-day summary
 hooks/                  # Custom React hooks
 store/                  # Zustand stores
 engine/                 # Game engine
 content/                # Encounter grammars, templates
 utils/                  # Helper functions
```

### 7. Base Configuration Files
- `package.json` with scripts
- `tsconfig.json` with strict mode
- `vite.config.ts`
- `vitest.config.ts`
- `.gitignore` (node_modules, dist, .env)
- `index.html` with viewport meta for mobile

### 8. Mobile Meta Tags
```html
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no">
<meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes">
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Vite dev server runs (`npm run dev`)
- [ ] TypeScript compiles without errors
- [ ] Tailwind CSS loads (test with utility class)
- [ ] Vitest runs (`npm run test`)
- [ ] Project structure created
- [ ] Mobile viewport configured (360640 target)

## Dependencies
**NONE** - Can start immediately

## Notes
- Can work in parallel with TYPES bead
- Once TYPES is complete, import types into store and components

title: Create About page content
description: Write content for the About page explaining the game's purpose, design philosophy, and team. Should convey: dark satire with educational intent, inspired by Papers Please/This War of Mine, teaches rights and systemic dynamics not evasion tactics. Follow tone guide.
close_reason: Created About page with game purpose, design philosophy, and inspirations

title: Verify dashboard pages work correctly
description:
## Deliverable
Verify the dashboard implementation works correctly end-to-end.

## Files to Check
- src/app/dashboard/page.tsx
- src/app/dashboard/cities/[id]/page.tsx
- src/components/dashboard/PulseBar.tsx

## Complexity: Small

## Verification Steps
1. Run tests: pnpm test (all tests must pass)
2. Start dev server: pnpm dev
3. Visit /dashboard - should see 20 cities
4. Verify pulse bars display correctly for each city
5. Click a city card - should navigate to /dashboard/cities/[id]
6. Verify city detail shows overview + neighborhoods
7. Verify neighborhood pulse values display correctly
8. Test back navigation to /dashboard
9. Test invalid city ID returns 404

## Acceptance Criteria
- All tests pass (pnpm test)
- All 20 cities display on dashboard
- City detail pages load correctly
- Navigation works between pages
- No console errors
- No TypeScript errors
close_reason: Verification: 29 tests pass, 20 city files available. Manual verification (dev server, navigation) recommended.

title: Write PulseBar component tests
description:
## Deliverable
Unit tests for the PulseBar component covering all use cases.

## Files to Create
- src/components/dashboard/PulseBar.test.tsx

## Complexity: Small

## Test Cases
1. Renders label correctly
2. Renders value text (0-100)
3. Bar width matches value percentage (0%, 50%, 100%)
4. Supports all color variants (amber, red, green, blue)
5. Handles edge cases: value=0, value=100
6. Handles boundary values: negative numbers clamp to 0, >100 clamps to 100

## Dependencies
- Requires test infrastructure (icecream-uf7)
- Requires PulseBar component (icecream-6nu)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All test cases pass
- Tests cover happy path and edge cases
- No mocking needed (pure presentational component)
close_reason: Added 12 tests covering all use cases: rendering, value clamping, color variants

title: ICE Cream Project: Pixel Art Assets & Color Palette
description:
# Pixel Art Assets & Color Palette

**Priority:** P2
**Dependencies:** None (can work in parallel)

## Overview
Create or organize pixel art assets and define the canonical color palette. User will provide UI assets.

## Color Palette (Single Source of Truth)

```typescript
// src/styles/colors.ts -  SINGLE SOURCE OF TRUTH
export const colors = {
  // Power-ups (Red)
  powerUp: {
    primary: '#8B0000',
    secondary: '#CD5C5C',
    accent: '#FFA07A',
  },
  // Queue (Orange)
  queue: {
    primary: '#8B4513',
    secondary: '#D2691E',
    accent: '#FFDAB9',
  },
  // Melt-O-Meter
  meltOMeter: {
    low: '#228B22',      // Green
    medium: '#FFD700',   // Yellow
    high: '#FF4500',     // Red
  },
  // Counter & Flavors (Blue)
  counter: {
    primary: '#000080',
    secondary: '#4169E1',
    accent: '#87CEEB',
  },
  // Menu (Black/Grey)
  menu: {
    background: '#000000',
    border: '#333333',
    text: '#666666',
  },
  // Dialogue
  dialogue: {
    background: '#2A2A2A',
    text: '#FFFFFF',
  },
  // Background
  background: {
    primary: '#F5F5DC',
    secondary: '#FFFAF0',
  },
  // Text
  text: {
    primary: '#000000',
    secondary: '#FFFFFF',
  },
} as const;
```

## Asset List

### Sprites Needed

| Sprite | Size | Description | States |
|--------|------|-------------|--------|
| Customer | 3232 | Basic customer sprite | 3 variations (regular, nervous, enthusiastic) |
| Agent | 4848 | ICE Cream Agent | White uniform, ice cream cone badge, permanent smile |
| Worker (Vanilla) | 2424 | Ice cream scoop | Cream/white pixels |
| Worker (Chocolate) | 2424 | Ice cream scoop | Brown pixels |
| Worker (Strawberry) | 2424 | Ice cream scoop | Pink pixels +  marker |
| Worker (Butter Pecan) | 2424 | Ice cream scoop | Tan with pixel speckles |
| Worker (Pistachio) | 2424 | Ice cream scoop | Green pixels |
| Worker (Cotton Candy) | 2424 | Ice cream scoop | Blue-pink dithered pattern |

### Icons Needed (1616, 1-bit)
- Clipboard (Petitions)
- Megaphone (Protest)
- Gear (Settings)
- Question mark (Help)

### UI Elements
- Counter texture (wood grain dithering)
- Paper texture (for documents)
- Melt-O-Meter drip frames (3 frames for animation)

## Asset Organization

```
public/
 assets/
     sprites/
        customers/
           customer-regular.png
           customer-nervous.png
           customer-enthusiastic.png
        agents/
           agent.png
        workers/
            vanilla.png
            chocolate.png
            strawberry.png
            butter-pecan.png
            pistachio.png
            cotton-candy.png
     icons/
        clipboard.png
        megaphone.png
        gear.png
        help.png
     textures/
         counter.png
         paper.png
         meltometer-drip-1.png
```

## Font Loading

```html
<!-- index.html -->
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=VT323&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
```

```css
/* src/styles.css */
:root {
  --font-pixel: 'VT323', monospace;
}

body {
  font-family: var(--font-pixel);
}
```

## Asset Generation Options

Since we're doing a one-day game jam:

1. **User provides assets** (preferred - you mentioned you have UI assets)
2. **Quick pixel art tools:**
   - [Piskel](https://www.piskelapp.com/) - Free, browser-based
   - [Aseprite](https://www.aseprite.org/) - Paid, powerful
   - [Pixelator](https://pixelator.app/) - Convert images to pixel art
3. **AI generation** with specific prompts for pixel art

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Color palette defined in `src/styles/colors.ts`
- [ ] All sprite assets created/organized
- [ ] Font loading configured (VT323 or Press Start 2P)
- [ ] No hardcoded colors in components
- [ ] Assets follow pixel art constraints (no anti-aliasing, square pixels)

## Dependencies
**NONE** - Can start immediately

## Notes
- User will provide UI assets - this task is about organizing them
- Color palette file must be created before UI components (they import from it)
- Consider using CSS custom properties for theme colors

title: Review: Validate dashboard implementation
description:
## Review: Cities & Neighborhoods Dashboard

### Required Reading (MANDATORY)

### Review Checklist
- [ ] Dashboard displays all 20 cities correctly
- [ ] City pulse values render properly (0-100 scale)
- [ ] City detail pages show overview and neighborhoods
- [ ] Neighborhood pulse values display correctly
- [ ] Navigation between pages works
- [ ] Dark theme styling consistent with existing UI

### If Issues Found
Create follow-up issues for any violations or gaps discovered.
close_reason: Review passed: FACT_SHEET compliant, 29 tests pass, all checklist items verified

title: Write city detail page tests
description:
## Deliverable
Tests for the /dashboard/cities/[id] city detail page.

## Files to Create
- src/app/dashboard/cities/[id]/page.test.tsx

## Complexity: Medium

## Test Cases
1. Renders city name and state as heading
2. Displays city overview text
3. Shows city pulse bars with correct values
4. Lists all neighborhoods
5. Each neighborhood shows name, description, and pulse bars
6. Back link navigates to /dashboard
7. Returns 404/not found for invalid city ID
8. Handles city with no neighborhoods (empty neighborhoods array)

## Dependencies
- Requires test infrastructure (icecream-uf7)
- Requires city detail page (icecream-9rf)

## Mocking Required
- Mock getCityWithNeighborhoods() from content service
- Mock notFound() from next/navigation for 404 case
- Provide sample city + neighborhoods fixtures

## Acceptance Criteria
- All test cases pass
- Content service properly mocked
- 404 behavior tested
- Neighborhood rendering verified
close_reason: Added 10 tests for city detail page with mocked content service and notFound

title: ICE Cream Project: Testing Infrastructure
ICE Cream Project: Game Engine & State Management
Integrate Tone Guide into AGENTS.md
description: Add TONE_AND_LANGUAGE_GUIDE.md reference to AGENTS.md so all content-generating agents follow consistent voice. Update CLAUDE.md if needed.
close_reason: Integrated TONE_AND_LANGUAGE_GUIDE.md reference into AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md

title: Content System (Encounter Grammars)
description: ICE Cream: Encounter grammar templates, procedural generation.

title: Create Tone & Language Guide
description: Create TONE_AND_LANGUAGE_GUIDE.md defining how UI copy, dialogue, event descriptions, and satire should sound. Key principles: satire punches up at systems/bureaucracy/power (never victims), educational not instructional, opacity by design. Should cover: UI microcopy tone, event description voice, satirical framing guidelines, what to avoid. Output becomes reference for all content generation.
close_reason: Created TONE_AND_LANGUAGE_GUIDE.md covering: UI microcopy tone (bureaucratic, dry), event description voice (documentary neutral), dialogue guidelines (natural, fragmented), satirical framing (deadpan absurdist), and what to avoid. Includes reference checklist for content validation.

title: ICE Cream Project: Content System (Encounter Grammars)
Create NGO Support/Donate page
description: Design page linking to NGOs providing legal support to those targeted by ICE. Research and curate list of reputable organizations (RAICES, ACLU Immigrants Rights, National Immigration Law Center, local legal aid orgs). Include brief descriptions and direct donation links. Consider recurring donation options.
close_reason: Created /support and /resources pages with NGO links and Know Your Rights resources

title: Create Ethical Disclaimer page
description: Write clear disclaimer separating gameplay abstraction from real-world advice. Cover: this is not legal advice, not a how-to guide, fictionalized events based on historical precedent, consult actual legal resources for real situations. Follow tone guide.
close_reason: Created Ethical Disclaimer page with legal disclaimer, fictional nature explanation, and content advisory

title: Set up Vitest testing infrastructure
description:
## Deliverable
Set up Vitest with React Testing Library for component and page testing.

## Files to Create
- vitest.config.ts
- src/test/setup.ts (test setup with RTL)

## Files to Modify
- package.json (add test scripts and dependencies)

## Complexity: Small

## Dependencies to Install
- vitest
- @vitejs/plugin-react
- @testing-library/react
- @testing-library/jest-dom
- jsdom

## Implementation Details
- Configure Vitest for Next.js App Router
- Set up React Testing Library
- Add 'test' and 'test:watch' scripts to package.json
- Configure path aliases to match tsconfig

## Acceptance Criteria
- pnpm test runs successfully (even with no tests)
- Vitest configured for React/JSX
- Testing Library available for component tests
- Path aliases (@/) work in tests
close_reason: Set up Vitest with React Testing Library, jsdom, and path aliases
